AD_RemiraBarthAtCorpses.synopsis: Remira and Aradin are discussing the fate of their fallen comrades at the hands of goblins

LeaderAtCorpses.synopsis: Aradin comes across the corpses of some of his friends, who were lost during the goblin raid. He's in a neutral location at a bridge and observing the corpses of his people and of goblins, who were also killed in the fight.
LeaderAtCorpses.how_to_trigger: OE code to setup dialogue:oe denraiddonenopeaceWithout OE code:Go to Den and trigger 'plea at gates'... after this, Aradin will get into an argument with Zevlor and needs to leave. He can then be found near dead bodies beside bridge near goblin camp. Co-ordinates X:86, Y:410

RaidAdventurerAtCorpses.synopsis: The adventurer is standing next to the corpses of her comrades she left behind while running for the goblins.

AD_DrunkenTalk.synopsis: Aradin mutters to himself while drinking after returning to the Druid Grove.

VB_AtCorpses.synopsis: Remarking on corpses on the road.

AD_AtCorpses.synopsis: Gallows humour, grimly delivered - the 'you' are the corpses of his fallen comrades, who he finds in a forest. But  he's effectively talking to himself.

RaidAdventurer.synopsis:
Age: mid-30-40s.
Female
Bio: Rough and working-class. A veteran of many expeditions, Remira is nonetheless shaken after a raid gone horribly wrong and trying to hide it behind bravado. She feels guilty for leaving a new recruit to die, but tries to wave it away and gets defensive if confronted over it. She’s sarcastic and casually racist.
RaidAdventurer.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevl WLD_Main_A3. goto 208.13, 26.57, 408.044. Trigger attack on Den and use killcombat to resolve it.5. Advance in the Den to the confrontation (206.18, 31.03, 474.82) and convince them not to fight.6. Move to 173.34, 18.29, 537.617. Wait for Remira and talk with her.

RobbedAdventurerAtCorpses.synopsis: The adventurer is standing next to the corpses of her comrades he left behind while running for the goblins.

AD_LeavingCorpses.synopsis: After encountering some dead adventurers in the forest, Aradin urges his remaining company to keep moving (only plays if he's not alone).

AD_AradinAndRemira.synopsis: Aradin and Remira are having a drink after arriving back in the Druid Grove.

AD_AdventurerCleaningWound.synopsis: Remira is cleaning a wound she got from the goblins. She winces and grunts in pain while checking out the damage.

reasoning: The session 'LeaderAtCorpses' describes Aradin's emotional response after discovering the corpses of his friends, which likely precipitates the discussions in 'AD_RemiraBarthAtCorpses' and 'AD_AtCorpses'. Therefore, 'LeaderAtCorpses' must come before both.
'AD_LeavingCorpses' occurs after encountering dead adventurers, indicating it follows 'LeaderAtCorpses' and possibly 'AD_AtCorpses' since the context is the same.

'RaidAdventurerAtCorpses' and 'RobbedAdventurerAtCorpses' both involve adventurers standing next to corpses, but they cannot coexist as they describe the same scenario with different characters involved. Therefore, they are mutually exclusive.
'AD_AradinAndRemira' takes place after Aradin and Remira have returned to Druid Grove, indicating it should come after 'LeaderAtCorpses'.
'AD_DrunkenTalk' likely takes place after 'AD_AradinAndRemira' since it depicts Aradin in a drunken state after the events with Remira.

AD_RemiraBarthAtCorpses_4.speaker: Barth
AD_RemiraBarthAtCorpses_4.text: He didn't make it this far. You saw them grab him.

AD_RemiraBarthAtCorpses_0.speaker: Barth
AD_RemiraBarthAtCorpses_0.text: Give it a rest. We have time.

LeaderAtCorpses_131.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_131.text: Thought you was busy with the foulbloods in Halsin's grove.

LeaderAtCorpses_104.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_104.text: Sucker-punching strangers - that's your bit, right?
LeaderAtCorpses_104.context: NodeContext: Sarcasitc and bitter, since the player hit him.

LeaderAtCorpses_138.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_138.text: I'm looking for Halsin. Heard you might know where he is?

LeaderAtCorpses_13.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_13.text: Still sore about that? You had it coming.

LeaderAtCorpses_98.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_98.text: Wasn't any of your business, though, was it?

LeaderAtCorpses_163.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_163.text: Didn't think this contract could go any worse. Then you showed up.

LeaderAtCorpses_24.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_24.text: The goblins need to be dealt with - so I'm dealing with them.

LeaderAtCorpses_161.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_161.text: Bet you will, too. Just like my mates here did.

LeaderAtCorpses_169.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_169.text: Contract cleverly left out we'd be tits deep in these buggers.

LeaderAtCorpses_76.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_76.text: I have somewhere else to be.

LeaderAtCorpses_78.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_78.text: Gonna find the wizard who gave us the contract that got my people killed. Left out all the important bits, like 'Beware, treasure's beneath a pile of goblins.'

LeaderAtCorpses_123.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_123.text: I left as quickly as I could. I don't waste my time with devilspawn.

LeaderAtCorpses_41.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_41.text: Smart. Those bastards'll spit on your grave after running you through.

LeaderAtCorpses_73.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_73.text: Tieflings... goblins... Gods, this contract was cursed from the first.

LeaderAtCorpses_152.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_152.text: The kind that leaves half your crew dead.

LeaderAtCorpses_0.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_0.text: There's a wizard in Baldur's Gate that'll pay gobloads for a relic supposedly buried round these parts.

LeaderAtCorpses_115.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_115.text: But gold ain't any use if you're too cold to spend it.

LeaderAtCorpses_140.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_140.text: Let's say I want that gold. Where would I find the relic?

LeaderAtCorpses_82.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_82.text: It's called the Nightsong. Supposed to be hidden under the temple where the goblins jumped us.

LeaderAtCorpses_14.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_14.text: I'd give you a map of the temple and wish you a happy funeral, but my mate Brian kept hold of it like his own todger. Goblins made short of the fat old chunk.

LeaderAtCorpses_120.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_120.text: All I've got's the contract. Can show you where we turned back, if you feel like dying.
LeaderAtCorpses_120.context: InternalNodeContext: Needs a mapmarker for goblins

LeaderAtCorpses_2.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_2.text: I hear the druids' leader went with you.

LeaderAtCorpses_11.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_11.text: As soon as he heard we had a contract to find that Nightsong relic, he was more eager than a hound in heat.

LeaderAtCorpses_156.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_156.text: When the goblins jumped us, most of my crew scarpered, just like I taught 'em to. The old codger didn't.

LeaderAtCorpses_50.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_50.text: And you just left him to die?

LeaderAtCorpses_12.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_12.text: Yeah, and I'd do the same again. He weren't my responsibility.

LeaderAtCorpses_150.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_150.text: If you want to play the hero, go ask the goblins nicely, and maybe they'll give you whatever's left of him.

LeaderAtCorpses_166.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_166.text: Hand over that contract - maybe I'll get the relic and save the druid.

LeaderAtCorpses_36.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_36.text: Where exactly did you get jumped?

LeaderAtCorpses_67.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_67.text: The goblins are holed up in some temple ruins out west. You'll smell 'em or hear their drums before you see 'em.

LeaderAtCorpses_100.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_100.text: I'll take the risk. Give me the contract.

LeaderAtCorpses_89.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_89.text: Heh, don't thank me. I'll be well on my way to Baldur's Gate when you die.

LeaderAtCorpses_17.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_17.text: I'm just glad to be rid of the bloody thing. Happy hunting.
LeaderAtCorpses_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: hands over contractInternalNodeContext: Needs a mapmarker for goblinsNodeContext: Hands over contract (piece of paper; can happen off-camera)

LeaderAtCorpses_6.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_6.text: This whole thing sounds like a setup.

LeaderAtCorpses_33.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_33.text: That, or a crock of shite.
LeaderAtCorpses_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Takes a swig from the bottle after he speaks.

LeaderAtCorpses_105.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_105.text: Before you go, I'd like to say a prayer for your crew.

LeaderAtCorpses_64.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_64.context: NodeContext: Bit skeptical. He's not a religious man but deep down he does want something said over his men.

LeaderAtCorpses_139.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_139.text: The Black Hand strikes and culls the unworthy. Yield in life, lest he reach for you even in death.

LeaderAtCorpses_32.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_32.text: Say another word, and I'll 'cull' you before you can blink.
LeaderAtCorpses_32.context: NodeContext: Responding to the player saying his crew had been culled in the natural order

LeaderAtCorpses_119.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_119.text: Lord of Murder, I dedicate their blood to you. Praise those who spilled it!

LeaderAtCorpses_66.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_66.text: Great. I've been wasting my breath on a Bhaal lunatic.

LeaderAtCorpses_102.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_102.text: May they find peace now, they who died fighting so others may live. We honour them as protectors.

LeaderAtCorpses_88.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_88.text: That's true. Without these lads, we'd've been cooked.

LeaderAtCorpses_57.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_57.text: Pretty good point, for a religious type. Which one's your god again?

LeaderAtCorpses_44.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_44.text: Your man Helm seems to know what he's talking about.

LeaderAtCorpses_62.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_62.text: He'll make himself known to you when you are ready.

LeaderAtCorpses_168.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_168.text: Would that we had taken these blows in their place - but let us honour their suffering.

LeaderAtCorpses_40.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_40.text: This was a good crew. They deserved better.
LeaderAtCorpses_40.context: NodeContext: First time he's said something halfway decent.

LeaderAtCorpses_126.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_126.text: Their death is but another step on the path. Kelemvor will judge them fairly.

LeaderAtCorpses_159.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_159.text: Nothing the lads would hate more than a judge waiting for 'em up there.

LeaderAtCorpses_37.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_37.text: These vessels are a reminder that death walks behind each of us, every day. None can outrun him. Praise Myrkul.

LeaderAtCorpses_93.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_93.text: We're leaving. Don't follow, if you know what's good for you.

LeaderAtCorpses_84.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_84.text: May their journey onwards be filled with as many wonders as they enjoyed in life.

LeaderAtCorpses_7.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_7.text: Whatever doubts and mysteries plagued them in life, may they be answered in death.

LeaderAtCorpses_121.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_121.text: Folks like us ain't got unanswered questions. We got contracts to finish and mouths to feed.

LeaderAtCorpses_112.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_112.text: May their path into the next plane be illuminated by a thousand gentle lights.

LeaderAtCorpses_28.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_28.text: I commend them to the darkness. When night falls, let them be forgotten.

LeaderAtCorpses_117.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_117.text: Hard to forget idiots like these. I don't think I'll bother trying.

LeaderAtCorpses_99.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_99.text: May their blades be ever sharp, and their arrows ever true. We honour them, for they fought to the last.

LeaderAtCorpses_35.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_35.text: Though I do not know how they lived, I know they died justly in combat. I honour that death.

LeaderAtCorpses_54.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_54.text: That's true, isn't it? My crew gave those nasty little shites as good as they got.

LeaderAtCorpses_118.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_118.text: Good point. For a religious type. Which one's your god again?

LeaderAtCorpses_130.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_130.text: I serve Tempus, god of war.

LeaderAtCorpses_90.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_90.text: Your man Tempus knows what he's talking about.

LeaderAtCorpses_22.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_22.text: Stay true to your blade and you will know his name soon enough.

LeaderAtCorpses_23.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_23.text: I pray their violent deaths find absolution in the Platinum Dragon's embrace.

LeaderAtCorpses_92.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_92.text: Should've expected judgement from a religious type. Typical.

LeaderAtCorpses_26.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_26.text: May the bards ever sing the song of your fallen.

LeaderAtCorpses_61.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_61.text: A song about my lot? Hah. Might toss a coin to a bard when I get back to the city.

LeaderAtCorpses_122.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_122.text: May their souls dance peacefully into the restful night.

LeaderAtCorpses_148.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_148.text: Don't see what good dancing'll do them.

LeaderAtCorpses_74.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_74.text: May the Gnomefather lead their souls over the Golden Hills.

LeaderAtCorpses_21.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_21.text: That's what I get for taking you religious types serious. Bollocks about gnomes.

LeaderAtCorpses_129.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_129.text: They died in the blood of their enemies, they died well. One-Eye watch them.

LeaderAtCorpses_9.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_9.text: Hm. I like that - they gave those wretched shites what for, after all.

LeaderAtCorpses_80.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_80.text: Who's that you prayed to, again? 'One-Eye'?

LeaderAtCorpses_149.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_149.text: The One-Eyed God. The Unsleeping. The Cursed One. GLORY TO GRUUMSH!

LeaderAtCorpses_143.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_143.text: Gruumsh. Creator. Watching God. First Power of the Orcs.

LeaderAtCorpses_19.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_19.text: I'll drop him a copper if I spot a shrine. Your man Gruumsh knows his stuff.

LeaderAtCorpses_135.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_135.text: Die with blade and blood in hand - then you will know his name.

LeaderAtCorpses_164.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_164.text: Doubt there's much chance of me dying otherwise.

LeaderAtCorpses_75.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_75.text: Laduguer - let these wretched fallen find solace as your slave-souls.

LeaderAtCorpses_141.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_141.text: These fallen lights burned short, Lord. May you remember their flames evermore.

LeaderAtCorpses_20.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_20.text: Rejoice! Their souls are ever snared in the demonwebs - to be feasted on by Mother.

LeaderAtCorpses_1.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_1.text: Though these souls are gone, they are not lost. May they grow again in time, as all things do.

LeaderAtCorpses_43.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_43.text: Aye. Gone but not forgotten, and all that.

LeaderAtCorpses_101.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_101.text: An end forged in battle is not one that will be forgotten. Remember them well.

LeaderAtCorpses_60.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_60.text: We pray: may those that felled these noble few be sundered by the vengeful storm.

LeaderAtCorpses_30.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_30.text: Reckon it ain't long til the goblins get what's coming. Hope so, at least.

LeaderAtCorpses_59.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_59.text: If their souls fall to the Hells, I pray they are quickly devoured by Her of the Many Maws.

LeaderAtCorpses_124.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_124.text: I pray their souls find luck overflowing in the afterlife.

LeaderAtCorpses_91.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_91.text: Shame luck couldn't find them sooner.

LeaderAtCorpses_147.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_147.text: Vlaakith'ka sivim hrath krash'ht. Vlaakith lash'a'rach.
LeaderAtCorpses_147.context: InternalNodeContext: meaning - "Only in vlaakith do we find light. Vlaakith make them pure."

LeaderAtCorpses_154.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_154.text: We pray that their spirits find nurture in the worlds beyond.

LeaderAtCorpses_71.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_71.text: 'We' ain't praying anything - that's all you.

LeaderAtCorpses_10.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_10.text: An adventurer's life is often short, but full of glory. May their journey onward be their next great adventure.

LeaderAtCorpses_111.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_111.text: Save your breath. They're too dead to hear you.

LeaderAtCorpses_128.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_128.text: Look, we're getting out of here. You should do the same.

LeaderAtCorpses_113.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_113.text: I pray their souls find rest, and their loved ones solace in this time of need.

LeaderAtCorpses_157.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_157.text: Shame solace don't put bread on the table.

LeaderAtCorpses_108.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_108.text: Forget it. Let's just get out of here.

LeaderAtCorpses_107.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_107.text: See you on the road, mate.

LeaderAtCorpses_151.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_151.text: You're giving up? I might take a shot at it myself.

LeaderAtCorpses_116.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_116.text: Have at it, if you think you can do better.

LeaderAtCorpses_86.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_86.text: True. I wouldn't risk it for twice the gold.

LeaderAtCorpses_153.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_153.text: Dunno what I expected. That much gold for some long-lost relic buried in the arse-end of nowhere. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

LeaderAtCorpses_3.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_3.text: And from a wizard too. I shoulda known. The gold probably turns to lead the moment you leave Baldur's Gate.

LeaderAtCorpses_79.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_79.text: A few goblins killed your whole crew? Pathetic.

LeaderAtCorpses_29.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_29.text: Wasn't no few goblins, mate. There's an entire hive of 'em. Contract failed to mention that part.

LeaderAtCorpses_83.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_83.text: I thought you were busy leading your crew.

LeaderAtCorpses_96.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_96.context: CinematicNodeContext: camera shows his dead crewNodeContext: Still blustering, but with resignation around the edges. He is sad about his dead crew, but he's trying not to show it.

LeaderAtCorpses_165.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_165.text: Contract didn't mention no goblins. I would've prepped the lads, brought better weapons...

LeaderAtCorpses_49.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_49.text: Honour demanded I extend my travels farther afield.

LeaderAtCorpses_8.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_8.text: That's a fancy way of saying 'I had something better to do.'

LeaderAtCorpses_160.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_160.text: Wish I'd had something better to do when I came across this contract. Bloody goblins ran through my crew - and all for nothing.

LeaderAtCorpses_63.speaker: Player
LeaderAtCorpses_63.text: Knock it off with that 'foulblood' shit.

LeaderAtCorpses_170.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses_170.text: Whatever you say. Don't matter anymore.

RaidAdventurerAtCorpses_0.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurerAtCorpses_0.text: I told them to run, the idiots.

RaidAdventurerAtCorpses_1.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurerAtCorpses_1.text: You better turn north here, or you'll end up like them.

RaidAdventurerAtCorpses_2.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurerAtCorpses_2.text: Go on. I'm sure you've got better places to be.
RaidAdventurerAtCorpses_2.context: NodeContext: harsh - trying to hold back tears until the player leaves.

AD_DrunkenTalk_1.speaker: Aradin
AD_DrunkenTalk_1.text: Ain't leavin' town for a good while after this.

AD_DrunkenTalk_2.speaker: Aradin
AD_DrunkenTalk_2.text: Can't wait to get back to the Gate.

VB_AtCorpses_0.speaker: Player
VB_AtCorpses_0.text: Were they heading to the druids' grove?

VB_AtCorpses_1.speaker: Player
VB_AtCorpses_1.text: I wonder where they were going.

AD_AtCorpses_0.speaker: Aradin
AD_AtCorpses_0.text: Lucky you. Done with this shite.

RaidAdventurer_1.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_1.text: Think you disappointed this lot, swooping in to save us like that. Careful - might turn on you just as quick.
RaidAdventurer_1.context: NodeContext: Spiteful, re tiefling refugees who had sealed them outside. Petty and mean-spirited.

RaidAdventurer_2.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_2.text: Once we're patched up, we're gone.

RaidAdventurer_6.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_6.text: Weren't no profit in saving Liam - you'd make a crap sellsword. But... thanks.
RaidAdventurer_6.context: NodeContext: Considering you, half pitying of your naive heroism, half pleasantly surprised by it.

RaidAdventurer_9.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Remira is dabbing at a cut on her arm and hissing in pain as we approach.NodeContext: Hissing in pain as she dabs at a wound on her arm.

RaidAdventurer_13.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer_13.text: Ogle the gash in her flesh.

RaidAdventurer_22.speaker: Narrator
RaidAdventurer_22.text: *You lose yourself in the scab's weeping sea. It is no masterwork, but it provides a base bliss to gaze upon.*
RaidAdventurer_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: dark urge getting a little bit excited and swoony

RaidAdventurer_20.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer_20.text: Wait for her to finish cleaning the wound.

RaidAdventurer_46.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_46.text: Like the sight of blood, do you? Thought you'd've had your fill at the gate.
RaidAdventurer_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Finishes cleaning wound and puts the [cleaning cloth] away.NodeContext: She's caught you standing there waiting - tone is challenging.

RaidAdventurer_5.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_5.text: Might be more blood spilled yet, if Zevlor starts in on the lectures again.
RaidAdventurer_5.context: NodeContext: Making a threat - all big talk with no real bite behind it.

RaidAdventurer_44.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer_44.text: You should probably get that looked at.

RaidAdventurer_17.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_17.text: We're packing up and I'd advise you do the same. Seems our kind ain't welcome here.

RaidAdventurer_27.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_27.text: We're packing up and I'd advise you do the same. Seems our kind ain't welcome here.

RaidAdventurer_29.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_29.text: Ah, the fighting foulblood. Glad to know one of you has a spine.
RaidAdventurer_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: She cleans her wound, a cut on her arm with a [cleaning cloth]

RaidAdventurer_8.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_8.text: As close as you're gonna get from me today, friend.
RaidAdventurer_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Finishes cleaning wound and puts the [cleaning cloth] away.

RaidAdventurer_3.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_3.text: Damn sight better than what Zevlor's got coming, after leaving us to die like that.

RaidAdventurer_18.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer_18.text: I already regret saving your life.

RaidAdventurer_33.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_33.text: Ah - bruised your feelings, did I? Excuse me if I don't weep - got problems of my own.
RaidAdventurer_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Finishes cleaning wound and puts the [cleaning cloth] away.

RaidAdventurer_51.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_51.text: My arm's near hanging off after wise Zevlor left us to die at the gate.

RaidAdventurer_43.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_43.text: And then he has the bloody gall to try and blame it all on us.

RaidAdventurer_34.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer_34.text: I'd have done the same in your place.

RaidAdventurer_26.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_26.text: Well. Finally - someone who ain't got horns where their good sense should be.
RaidAdventurer_26.context: NodeContext: She's usually defensive but you've just signalled you might be on her side. The line is vaguely racist towards tieflings - even the version addressed to tieflings themselves.

RaidAdventurer_19.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer_19.text: He let you in, didn't he? It could have been worse.

RaidAdventurer_16.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_16.context: NodeContext: You're trying to be gracious and she's not having any of it.

RaidAdventurer_10.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_10.text: We expected a soft job. Something to test the new lad, maybe, but not a bloody goblin nest.
RaidAdventurer_10.context: NodeContext: She's justifying her actions - they'd taken on a job that seemed simple but quickly got out of hand. People died and she's doggedly maintaining that she's the victim. More explanatory than whiny, though.

RaidAdventurer_37.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_37.text: Most would've turned tail at the sight. But not Liam, no - he charged them, the stupid bastard.
RaidAdventurer_37.context: NodeContext: She's genuinely hurt at the loss of this recruit but projecting a knowing persona to hide it, as if his bravery is somehow a rookie mistake. Note of incredulity rather than laughing at him, as if he did something very stupid.

RaidAdventurer_35.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer_35.text: I'm guessing that didn't end well.

RaidAdventurer_25.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_25.text: Nah. He... must've thought we were following. Always the optimist, was Liam.
RaidAdventurer_25.context: NodeContext: Rare moment of honesty and reflection. Still trying to act tough, but thinking about the fact that Liam may have actually looked up to her and she's let him down.

RaidAdventurer_38.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_38.text: Hope they cut him down quick before he saw we were gone.
RaidAdventurer_38.context: NodeContext: Quietly - she's ashamed but still trying to brush it off.

RaidAdventurer_50.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer_50.text: So you just left your friend to the goblins?

RaidAdventurer_40.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_40.text: These weren't no normal goblins. And Liam weren't no friend, all right?
RaidAdventurer_40.context: NodeContext: Immediately defensive - you're questioning her courage and suggesting she has feelings, two cardinal sins

RaidAdventurer_30.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_30.text: Just another raw recruit thought he was in some storybook.
RaidAdventurer_30.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, disgusted - it's his own fault he's dead. Or that's what she's trying to tell herself.

RaidAdventurer_32.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer_32.text: He died with bravery. You should be proud.

RaidAdventurer_42.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_42.text: Bravery? No. When it gets you killed, it's just called stupidity.
RaidAdventurer_42.context: NodeContext: Scornful, but hiding real hurt. He died because she ran and she's in denial.

RaidAdventurer_15.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_15.text: That was lesson one, if Liam had only bloody listened.
RaidAdventurer_15.context: NodeContext: Tone is very much 'I tried to train him properly but I can only do so much'

RaidAdventurer_4.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer_4.text: A good death. He earned his place in Warrior's Rest.

RaidAdventurer_49.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_49.text: Warrior, my arse - not even Tempus himself could teach Liam to swing straight.
RaidAdventurer_49.context: NodeContext: Snorting, derisive - you're making him out to be grander than he was.

RaidAdventurer_31.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_31.text: But aye, maybe you could... say a prayer, or something? Just... put in a good word, like.
RaidAdventurer_31.context: NodeContext: Moment of reflection - she's more superstitious than religious, but you're a priest suggesting that her friend might have earned a place of prestige in the afterlife and she almost wants to believe it.

RaidAdventurer_52.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer_52.text: You are to blame - you put his people in danger.

RaidAdventurer_21.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_21.text: And what about our people? Half the crew's lying dead back in that ruin.
RaidAdventurer_21.context: NodeContext: Feeling hard done by - you're pointing out the harm she did and she's acting like she's the one harmed.

RaidAdventurer_11.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_11.text: Even the new lad - his first contract, and we land him in a godsdamned goblin nest.
RaidAdventurer_11.context: NodeContext: Shaking her head at how the job went badly

RaidAdventurer_53.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_53.text: He actually stood and fought, the stupid bastard. Like I never trained him better.
RaidAdventurer_53.context: NodeContext: She's genuinely hurt at the loss of this recruit but projecting a knowing persona to hide it, as if his bravery is somehow a rookie mistake. Note of incredulity rather than laughing at him, as if he did something very stupid.

RaidAdventurer_7.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer_7.text: You should get that arm seen to.

RaidAdventurer_28.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_28.text: Oh aye? I was just going to let it fall off, stick it in my satchel.
RaidAdventurer_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Finishes cleaning wound and puts the [cleaning cloth] away.NodeContext: Tone is 'oh I hadn't thought of that, you're so smart' - but mocking and sarcastic

RaidAdventurer_39.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer_39.text: Ain't letting anyone here near me. They all sat and watched while Zevlor near got us killed.
RaidAdventurer_39.context: NodeContext: Resentful - she's feeling extremely hard done by because the tieflings blame her and her party for an attack that just occured.

RobbedAdventurerAtCorpses_0.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurerAtCorpses_0.text: You better not linger for too long. Those goblins just aren't normal.

RobbedAdventurerAtCorpses_1.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurerAtCorpses_1.text: Damn it. I wish we could at least give them a proper burial.

AD_AradinAndRemira_1.speaker: Remira
AD_AradinAndRemira_1.text: You shouldn't have brought Liam along. Lad was too young.

AD_AradinAndRemira_0.speaker: Aradin
AD_AradinAndRemira_0.text: Everyone needs to cut their teeth sometime.

AD_AradinAndRemira_6.speaker: Remira
AD_AradinAndRemira_6.text: Cut his teeth?! For his sake, I hope he's dead already.

AD_AradinAndRemira_8.speaker: Aradin
AD_AradinAndRemira_8.text: We finish this bottle. Got enough dead to toast, anyway.

AD_AradinAndRemira_3.speaker: Remira
AD_AradinAndRemira_3.text: Not the worst plan you've had lately.

AD_AdventurerCleaningWound_1.speaker: Remira
AD_AdventurerCleaningWound_1.context: NodeContext: Nnggh = grunt of pain while tending to her wound.

AD_AdventurerCleaningWound_2.speaker: Remira
AD_AdventurerCleaningWound_2.text: Hope the goblins aren't smart enough to poison their blades...

AD_AdventurerCleaningWound_3.speaker: Remira
AD_AdventurerCleaningWound_3.text: Agh... this'll leave a mark. Bloody goblins.
